page.title: 04GENERAL PRACTITIONER
page.content: Dr. Berg is a general practitioner in Hoddesdon, Broxbourne in Herts.. He works from a surgery with five other doctors. Ten other people work there; a secretary, nurse, six receptionists, a cleaner and a gardener. There are twelve rooms in the surgery; five consulting rooms, one reception room, a secretary's office, another office, two toilets, a waiting room and a staff room. Each day the Dr arrives at 8.30am, and first sorts outs his mail. He starts seeing patients at 9.00am. He has lunch between 11.00am and 11.30am. After lunch he returns to his surgery or visits people who are to ill to see him. About 170 people come each day except Sunday. The most serious illnesses he has dealt with are Cancers, Strokes and Heartattacks while coughs and colds are most common.{
